questions.question: How does iterative model pruning reduce the size of a machine learning (ML) model?
options: It uses a larger teacher model to transfer knowledge to a smaller student model.
It changes the representation of weights within the model to the most space-efficient representation.
It removes the least important parameters or nodes from a model.
It reduces the size of the training dataset.
correct_answers: It removes the least important parameters or nodes from a model.
